Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a shopping trip, and more”
Reviews.Author: Irkutsk22
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this small unpretentious hotel, within 5 minutes from Piazza di Spagna. The room was recently renovated, hotel staff friendly and helpful, all in all very good value for money. It is in a very central, but not too touristy area, which means it was not too loud. Plenty of places to eat (various price ranges), close proximity to many sights and the train station is 5 minutes away by taxi. I found breakfast satisfying, but here opinions may differ. I definitely recommend this place, and will surely use it again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just remodeled, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EdDallas
Reviews.Content: Recommend to anybody, no doubt! We spent 4 nights, in a room like the new one that the pics show. I think that the other pics are before the remodeling (hotel told us they did it late 2011), because the full hotel looked new (I don't think they left rooms without remodeling...). It was probably the cheapest double room (we got a very good deal for the whole Rome, imagine on that area...), not big (~20sqm) but modern, with LCD TV, small fridge (just part of the minibar), a small table and closet with safe. Good bed too. It had a window facing the street, with typical/nice view of Rome streets, quite well isolated for noise (not perfect) but during the night it was quiet (no traffic). We didn't hear either the other rooms. The restroom was also small but had a shower, toilet, bidet, sink... All very clean. Breakfast was on the top terrace (read nice view). Good, of continental kind... Cereal, yoghourt, tasty pastry, breads... and the lady there is probably the most dedicated waitress I've seen. The staff in general was very attentive. Only con is that the WiFi in our room was pretty bad/can't use, but actually I think it is only advertised in the reception, so... Bottom line, no luxuries but you can't beat it, including its location (half way between the Spanish steps and the Fontana di Trevi, ~5min from each). By the way, we loved Rome and their people!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choose”
Reviews.Author: ahmet_onal
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable place . There has been newly renovated, brand new. Excellent location in every respect. Easy to find a place. Very close to each place. Breakfast was successful. Especially in very quiet rooms overlooking the back side. Every time I go, and easily I can recommend a place for me to choose.

Reviews.Title: “good for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: zinniabaruah
Reviews.Content: 1st of all rome is an expensive destination and for budget travellers hotel pincio is of great value becoz unlike other budget hotels Pincio is clean, location is good (very near the metro station and spanish steps), rooms are comfortable in size considering europe and the staff is very helpful. but i only have one problem with the hotel that the breakfast should have more variety...i mean atleast they should have eggs for breakfast if not bacon or sausages..however there lots of cheap places nearby the hotel to have food..

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for location. Clean & comfortable. Loved the rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: This small family run hotel met our expectations for an inexpensive centrally located base from which we could walk to major downtown tourist sites. We took a taxi from the airport, and then walked non-stop for the 3-days we were in Rome ... 5-minutes to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and the shopping district along Via del Corso; 10-min to the Pantheon; 20-min to Piazza Navona and the Colosseum. The rooms are very simple and sparsely decorated, but the bed was comfortable and the neighborhood appeared safe & quiet. The staff at the front desk spoke English. I did appreciate the safe included in the room (for passports,etc). Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace - again nothing fancy, but sitting outdoors was a very nice touch (we took advantage of sitting outside in the evening with a glass of wine and a deck of cards)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Desireable area in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheCarryonTravellers
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. The rooms are very basic but anyone who stays in the room and doesn't get out into the city should not stay in a hotel like this one. The breakfast in the mornings was served upstairs on the terrace and it was wonderful. All beverages (coffee tea, hot chocolate) were served with steamed milk (if requested) and that makes such a difference. We also used the terrace in the evenings to have some wine and talk with other guests. Wifi worked well with our iPhone but only on the main floor where reception was. This is not a place to stay if you are infirm, the hotel reception is on the 2nd floor and our room was on the 5th. There's an elevator but it is tiny and can barely fit 2 people with carry on bags. We only used it twice, while moving in and out of the hotel. The stairs don't have handrails and might pose a problem for someone who suffers from positional vertigo or who gets dizzy going down a winding road. Our first night we ate at a hotel recommended restaurant and it was decent but we got the feeling that had we not been so hungry, we could have chosen something better on our own. The location was fantastic. We could see the church at the top of the Spanish Steps from our windows. If you are a light sleeper, keep in mind all the rooms surround the central staircase and the lift runs up and down the center of the stairs. We were one floor below the breakfast terrace so we could hear people coming up to eat and the milk being steamed. Rather than it bothering us, we found it charming and it was an incentive to get up and eat before adventuring out. We were able to use the computer (a Mac) provided for guests to check in for our connecting flight and look up restaurants, but describing it was a "business center" would be a stretch. We would return, the staff were lovely and it was a good base for getting to most of the sights. We easily walked to the Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi and the Metro/subway.

Reviews.Title: “quaint, quirky and retro”
Reviews.Author: goredbirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early June. Let me first say that the location could not have been better. We went to our room, which was towards the rear of the building. Upon entry we were greeted by a chorus of jackhammers just outside our windows. This lasted our entire stay, although we were not in the room much during the day, The room consisted of a queen size bed and a chair that folded out into a cot. Both were like sleeping on a piece of plywood board. The shower as stated in previous post was about the size of a telephone booth. The elevator/lift was not working properly our entire stay, but we were getting used to the walking and steps that come with Rome. The air conditioner was controlled by management at the front desk. They would turn it off as you left the hotel and we would get back to a hot and steamy room. The room would be nice and cool by the next morning, The staff at the front desk were very helpful, but you will not get much from the elderly owner, Breakfast was nothing special, I showed up five minutes early one morning and the lady working told me I would have to leave until the correct time. Although the price and location were unbeatable for Rome I probably would not stay here unless I was by myself. There were three of us staying in this room and it was quite close quarters,

Reviews.Title: “Location location LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint little Hotel and from what I'm told, good value - although that's hard to judgw as the prices at ALL hotels in Rome appear outrageously high! Still, this was a family run concern with cute, clean rooms and did I mention the location/ Just around the corner from the Via Trtone and the Spanish Steps, 5 mins from the Trevi Fountain and countless piazzas and stores! The bathrooms are tiny and I wouldn't recommend this Hotel for anyone who is supersized - you'd be hard pressed to even get into the shower if you're not fairly slim. I have 36" hips and found it a squeeze! Still, the breakfast on the rooftop and the lovely view of the rooftops of Rome were gorgeous! If you have large suitcases, be warned that the elevator will only take you part of the way. I stayed in two different rooms due to travelling to the Amalfi Coast for a few days in the middle and both were great! #74 up on the 7th floor was my fave! By the way there's a great restaurant just on the way to the Spanish steps that has the BEST antipasto buffet I've seen - walk along the Via Macelli and it's at the quiet corner of the piazza!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quirky, Cheerful but not cheap for what you get”
Reviews.Author: dtiwine2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights from 13th Oct 09. Booked through hotels own internet where we got offer of E493 instead of E600, and tripadvisors reports were all very good. Location wise it is excellent - half way between Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps, and just a stroll to good shops, restaurants and bars. The hotel is basically a narrow terrace building. Access to reception is up narrow winding marble stairs, and there you might have the pleasure of meeting 'the director' who has very little English. I though he was showing us to our room but instead he showed us the lift - as there was no way that any more than 2 people could have got into it. (or anyone bigger than normal size). You step into this 'box' close the outer metal gates and inner glass doors and then you ascend up a chute, seeing every floor on the way. Our room was at the very top of the house (probably because I asked for a room with a view - which it had of rooftops and a nice domed roof- and we had to walk the last small flight of stairs as the lift didnt go the whole way. Our room was straight opposite the roof top terrace where breakfast is served each morning, so everyone else had to take the lift up each morning. Therefore the noise of the lift starts before 7.00am each morning, so dont expect to be able to have a lie in. The roof top terrace is quite nice and must be really lovely when the weather would be a bit warmer. We had beautiful weather but early morning and evening was very cool, so you had to wrap up well for breakfast. This would have been fine if you were tucking into a big Irish or English fry, but breakfast consisted of juice, croissants, crusty roll, butter, jam or spreadable cheese, and yoghurts , tea,coffee or hot chocolate,which I thought was very meagre for the price of the hotel. I dont think that cereal /fruit and nuts would have broken the bank but it would have made it seem a bit better value.The rooms were very simple - I felt I had gone back in time 30 years. You certainly wont be stocking up on the toiletries as one usually does after an hotel stay - it was all little plastic sachets . however - the staff were very nice, the place was very clean, the bedlinen was crisp and fresh, there was a computer room with free access to internet which was very handy. Location was excellent. I liked to go to the terrace to read a book in the sunshine after all the walking about - (unfortunately I only discovered the deckchair tucked away at the stairs the day I left). I read another reviewer say that they brought back wine and snacks to eat on the terrace before they went out in the evening and I can see how this would be a good idea in the warmer weather. We found our room cold but that was probably because it was directly opposite the rooftop terrace and once the sun went down it was very cool but then it was October after all - I am sure the opposite is the case in the summer). We mentioned that it was cold at reception and the boy on reception explained that the director thought it was too soon to turn on the heating, but he did leave us in an oil filled electric heater which did the trick. I rely so much on tripadvisor for reviews before I visit or book anywhere and I therefore always leave a review of where I have been. I have had to think long and hard about my rating for this hotel as I would score it highly on location, cleanliness, service. I suppose I feel that for the price it was very basic and simple - however in saying that I had searched the internet for days and wasnt coming up with anything which sounded much better value. There is a very nice italian deli/restaurant just three doors up on the left - cannot remember the name = something like Os entorio - but you will see the newspaper clippings and reviews in the window and inside. They speak very little english but the food is good as it is packed with local people. We also called in for just a night cap, as the hotel has no bar. We found another very nice modern but comfortable restaurant /pizzeria/wine bar called 'Life'- address is 28/30 Via della Vite - good food and good value. Also ate in La Scaletta Via S.maria dell'Anima near Plaza Navonna which again was reasonably priced. Remember to visit Romes oldest cafe Caffe Greco on the Via Condotti facing the Spanish Steps. Whatever you do dont sit down, just order your coffee at the till and stand and drink it at the counter opposite - it is really lovely and inexpensive. If you are near the Colloseum there is a busy italien restaurant called Le Naumachie, on Via Dei Santi Quattro - it is really busy with locals so it must be good. We visited the Colloseum but we thought it was as impressive outside as it is inside so unless you really really want to go in, I would save the 14 euro entrance fee and buy a calendar with lovely pictures. On the other hand, The basilica, the vatican & museums (dont miss the tapestry 'the ressurection of Christ' where both the tomb stone and the Christ's eyes follow you as you pass by - a real optical illusion!), pantheon, spanish steps, trevi fountain, the building at piazza venetio is really worth seeing. In summary, we had a great time - the only thing that is making us score this hotel 3 is that we just felt it was a bit pricey for its simplicity and the breakfast, but other than that I would be happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Location”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelingTarHeels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before our cruise and one night afterwards. We felt this hotel captured the charm of an authentic Roman experience. Our first room was # 58 in the back. It was very quiet which is exactly what I was looking for in a hotel room. The décor in this room could use a little updating, but the sheets and towels were crisp and clean. The room itself was spotless. The A/C worked fine and the shower had great water pressure. We stayed in # 54 in the front of the hotel on our last night in Rome. This room had been updated with new wallpaper and a great ceiling design. It was slightly noisy early in the evening, but quite calm later at night. It had the same crisp clean sheets and towels and spotlessly clean room. What we loved about this room, when we opened our window, were the church bells we heard Sunday morning as we were preparing to leave. We absolutely loved the rooftop terrace for breakfast. Breakfast itself was simple with croissants, breads and yogurt. I would have liked some fruit. The coffee was excellent. In the afternoon we bought food at a nearby grocery store and had wine and hors d’oeuvres on the terrace before dinner. That was a fantastic plus for this hotel. You do have to walk up one flight of stairs to get to the reception area, but the owner offered to carry my suitcase. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The elevator is small and can hold three people or one person with two suitcases. The location cannot be beat. As everyone else has said, the Spanish steps are literally around the corner and the Trevi Fountain a couple of blocks further. The advantage to being in the middle of all the sights is that you can pop into your room for a quick fresh-up or short nap and be back in the middle of the action as soon as you step out the door.

Reviews.Title: “still a gem”
Reviews.Author: t2803h
Reviews.Content: pincio hotel is a small gem ! old roman building , perfect location , friendly and efficient staff , family atmosphere , nice continental bfast on a wonderful terrace overlooking the city , clean rooms ! forget the the so called deluxe chain hotels ! and have a glimpse and the feeling of ROMA ! the frenchy , PARIS

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi-Girlie
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Pincio, there were 9 of us, including 5 children, and we stayed for 4 nights. What a fab wee place! A little dated some would say but it was very clean, and fresh sheets and towels daily. The staff were very knowledgeable and helpfull too. We really liked the terrace where we had breakfast and the waitress was charming with a lovely smile. Yes, the stairs are a bit daunting with your suitcases but they are marble! and the walls in the little lounge area are covered in padded fabric! And they have a quaint little glass and wrought iron lift. It was just so full of character. It's location couldn't be better, 2 mins to the spanish steps one way and 5 mins to the trevi fountain the other! I throroughly recommend this hotel, just don't all stay there when I want to go back ok?! LOL :-)

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nyknicksfanatic
Reviews.Content: While the Pincio's proximity to the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain make it convenient for tourists, nothing else makes it memorable. Please note that you need to walk up one flight to get to the lobby, and the old building has been retro-fitted with a tiny elevator that barely accomodates one person and their luggage. My wife & I recently spent two nites here, and we tried to spend as much time away from our room as possible. While the rooms are clean and the staff was helpful, the decor is very bland with terrible lighting and just one window. Overall, the Hotel Pincio is an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “True Gem of a Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: b0zie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pincio doesn't look like much from the outside, and is the case with most hotels in Italy, but once you get inside you get a true feel of old Italy. The elevator shaft is in the center of the building and highlights how things once looked long ago. You're greeted at the top of the stairs by the owner/son and are instantly asked where you would like to go and prepare a map for you. The rooms are quaint - old wallpaper, little rooms, with full bathrooms. Open the windows because this is where you get the true Rome experience - clanking dishes from the cafes below, people laughing and talking along the streets. They serve breakfast on the roof top patio and have great coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with clean, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: coloradojem
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and found it to be perfect for our needs. The location was very central - we were able to walk to most sights or take short cab rides and we also utilized the nearest metro stop a few times. The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. The street noise might be a problem for light sleepers, but earplugs worked great for me. The breakfast terrace was lovely, however the food was just okay. We wound up getting breakfast elsewehere most mornings. Overall, a great value for under 200 euros a night, especially if you just want a clean place to sleep and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tash_nat_27
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pincio is literally a 2min walk to the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain. In the center of Rome, with a great view of Rome on the patio during breakfast. We had a quad room in the center of Rome at a minimal cost. I will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Lela#1
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far is the greatest location in the heart of Rome, the rooms are just adequate and clean, the owner of the hotel super super nice, overall an excellent choice look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great value, excellent staff, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Jopoloco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pincio from May 11th thru the 18th and had a wonderful time. We were lucky enough to get the only room on the top floor, right across from the breakfast mezzanine and it was excellent. Room 74 is a corner room at the back of the building with two windows and a beautiful cross breeze. In the mornings we woke to the smell of coffee and breakfast and for the rest of the day the floor was ours. Breakfast service was outstanding! We traveled with friends who's room was on the 3rd floor and every evening we would meet on the mezzanine and have a glass of wine before heading out for dinner. It was like our own private terrace. Our friend's room faced the street and for the first two days their a/c wasn't cooling their room adequately. Opening their windows let the street noise in and so they weren't really happy until the a/c was working properly. Our room was very clean, the maid service was excellent, and everyone on staff was as nice as could be. The Internet access wasn't what I'd expected - I brought my laptop thinking I could get online - but they had an Apple desktop in a computer room downstairs available. It was still valuable being able to download my camera pictures onto my laptop but otherwise having it was useless. The shower was small, a tight fit, and if you drop the soap you better be able to squat 'cause there's not enough room to bend over. Be sure to bring a travel adapter for the electricity! This was our first trip to Rome and we definitely want to go back. Staying at the Pincio again would be wonderful. We loved our location and probably logged 6 to 8 miles a day seeing the sights and wandering around Rome. Because the hotel elevator doesn't go down to the first floor, the Pincio wouldn't be a great hotel for someone with a walking issue - but for that matter Rome might not be a good idea either as there's a lot of walking to do.

Reviews.Title: “Lcation, location, location- brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Bobbysox_7
Reviews.Content: Location excellent for walking to the Spanish Steps & Trevi and not far from all of the ancient sites, we easily walked tofrom the Vatican Cty. Our first morning I was out running at 6 in the Borghese Park, which is just up nearby Pincio Hill & behind the Steps. An hours canter before a shower & breakfast which is served between 7 & 10am. The rooms are clean & well looked after with plenty of drawer space etc. Staff helpful & always attentive. No problems recommending to anyone looking for a relaxing base. Breakfast were usual continental but plenty of it & set us up for the day. Quaint lift which holds 4 people or 2 with luggage!. Real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseDublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night stay at the Hotel Pincio in Rome. We were looking for a hotel close to some of the attractions in Rome and this hotel was perfect as it was just minutes away from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the main shopping streets. The room in the hotel was surprisingly large, the staff were so helpful and friendly. The added bonus of free internet access in reception was great. I would most certainly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Rome and was reasonably priced for the time of year (Easter). I have nothing negative to say about this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pincio is clean, has nice stuff and a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nippes2022
Reviews.Content: Very nice room to the back. Street side is not very noisy, but backside is much better. You have to go up one flight of stairs without elevator to the reception on the first floor, but stuff will help you with luggage. Noisy elevator and rather thin walls, but compared to other hotels in Rome, really a bargain. Nice breakfast terrace above the roofs with marvelous view, Fontana di Trevi, Spanish steps, Forum Romanum, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and so on in walking distance. Very near to Villa Borgese. Ideal for summer, room with nice tiles on the floor, probably rather cool. Very good matrasses, enough clean towels,and very nice stuff. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: oaklandcondo
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel exceeded my expectations. My wife and I were recommended to this hotel because of its central location to everything. We requested a quiet room and were given room 52 in the back. I must say that the room was indeed very quiet at night. The hotel is old so dont expect much in regards to modernization. The good things that I have to say about this hotel is its location, clean, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pincio”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late August 2006. Our choice was based on positive reviews on this site plus its good location. In the event, we were delighted with our experience. The rooms were clean with good facilities and breakfast on the roof top was an absolute delight (although confined to continental type consisting of rolls, jam and yoghurt). The hotel decor was charmingly quirky, with paintings on each floor and a cute old elevator. This was exactly what I imagined a family run hotel in Rome should be like! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was very central, a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and Spagna Metro as well as a few minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain. I would certainly stay there again. The only caution I can advise is that due to the long staircase from the street to reception, this hotel might not suit people who have difficulty with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Okay... but lacking something”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the upside – it's 5 minutes from the Spanish steps and surrounding shops, 10-15 minutes from the Pantheon and Trevi fountain and is probably a bit cheaper than other hotels in the area. The breakfast was fine, served on the top floor terrace and the woman we had most interaction with was friendly and helpful, able to sort out football tickets and other queries. On the downside, other staff were wearily unsmiling and the general atmosphere was a bit on the dreary side; the room was 'clean'; and spacious, but a smell of stale pipe smoke and cleaning products wasn't the ideal fragrance for a three day stay; the bath was only marginally bigger than a basin; and while getting up early in Rome is probably a good idea anyway, hearing staff crashing around moving furniture at 7 in the morning made it pretty much compulsory on one day. Probably fine for a short trip when you're out most of the time anyway but if you're staying longer than a couple of nights and want a hotel or B&B with a bit of charm or to relax in your room, this might not be the place. Maybe I'm asking too much for 135 Euros (February) but I reckon there's much better value to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in November, I have to say it was excellent, room was spacious enough for a twin room, the staff friendly and helpful. Unfortunatly the balcony in the dining area wasn't open at breakfast, so we didn't get to see what looked like amazing views from the terrace, the only downside of visiting Rome in November!! The location, WOW!! not sure we could have got better - a short walk from most of the central attractions of Rome. Also not very far from cafes and other places to eat. (we stayed Bed and Breakfast.) A short walk from one of the central metro stations, and only 3 mins from the hotel door to the Trevi! Would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday, and found the hotels location and hospitality excellent. We walked everywhere from this location, and saw everything we wanted to in three days. We even managed to fit in a Lazio game at the Stadio Olympico, which the manager of the hotel arranged for us to get there. We will stay again, when we take the kids back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pincio - I garantee”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a tour to Italy and I can say that this Hotel is really good, the staff is lovely, the rooms are very comfortable and the location is excellent ( just close to the Spanish steps and to the Fontana di Trevi. Is it a familiar Hotel. The breakfast is good and it is served on the top of the building with a pleasent view. Renée- Curitiba - Brasil

HotelInfo.Name: Pincio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Capo le Case 50, 187 Rome, Italy
